'''Nielthi''' was the "Handmaid of [[Melian|Gwendelin]]"<ref>{{LT2|Index}}, entry "''Nielthi''"</ref> who was briefly mentioned in an earlier stage of [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]]'s legendarium, in the tale of [[The Nauglafring]].<ref name=lt>{{LT2|IV}}, pp. 231-2</ref>

While [[Thingol|Tinwelint]] was out celebrating the anniversary of the [[Hunting of the Wolf]], Gwendelin sat foreboding. When Nielthi, an [[Elf]]maid, asked her why she was sorrowful at such an occasion, Gwendelin responded that she could feel evil seeking their land, and that her days in Artanor were "speeding to their end". Nielthi attempted to reassure the queen by stating that they should not fear because the [[Girdle of Melian|great magic woven about them]] would surely protect them. In response, Gwendelin claimed that, to her, there seemed to be "a rat that" gnawed "the threads and all the web" had "come unwoven".<ref name=lt />

At that moment, "there was a cry about the doors" and many [[Orcs]] and [[Indrafangs]] burst in, as they were [[battle in the Thousand Caves|sacking Artanor]]. The fate of Nielthi is unknown.<ref name=lt />

==Etymology==
''Nielthi'' is presumed to be a [[Gnomish]] name on [[Eldamo]].<ref>{{webcite |author= [[Paul Strack]]|articleurl= https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-437751179.html|articlename= G. Nielthi ''f''.|dated= |website= Eldamo|accessed= 31 December, 2025|archiveurl= |archivename= |archivedate=}}</ref> The name might be a combination of ''niel'' ("granddaughter")<ref>{{webcite |author= [[Paul Strack]]|articleurl= https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-191901279.html|articlename= G. niel ''n''.|dated= |website= Eldamo|accessed= 31 December, 2025|archiveurl= |archivename= |archivedate=}}</ref> and ''-thi'' ("noun suffix")<ref>{{webcite |author= [[Paul Strack]]|articleurl= https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-2940013929.html|articlename= G. #-thiÂ¹ ''suf''.|dated= |website= Eldamo|accessed= 31 December, 2025|archiveurl= |archivename= |archivedate=}}</ref>.
